lv.lumii.layoutengine

Class Container

  • java.lang.Object
    • lv.lumii.layoutengine.Element
      • lv.lumii.layoutengine.AbstractContainer
        • lv.lumii.layoutengine.Container
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Box

    public class Container
extends AbstractContainer
    The Container class specifies a group of diagram elements. The geometrical layout of the elements is specified by its AbstractContainer.layoutConstraints.

      • getContainers

        public java.util.ArrayList<Container> getContainers()
        Returns all containers that are children of this container. The returned set contains boxes and containers that are not instantiated by another class extending the Container class. To get boxes and non-box containers separately, use the direct access getBoxes() and getPureContainers() methods.
        Returns:
        the set of all this container's child containers.

      • getPureContainers

        public java.util.ArrayList<Container> getPureContainers()
        Returns all containers that are owned by this container. Note that this method does not return the boxes that are owned by this container though they also are instances of Container class (for that purpose use the getContainers() method).
        Returns:
        the set of all this container's child pure containers.

      • getLines

        public java.util.ArrayList<Line> getLines()
        Returns all child lines of this container.
        Returns:
        all child lines of this container.

      • getOwner

        public Container getOwner()
        Description copied from class: Element
        Each element can be owned by some other element. When an owner is deleted, it deletes all objects owned by it. A box's owner is a container (or one of its derived classes â€” another box or diagram), a line is owned by a container. A label is owned by a box, a line, a label or a container. Container's owner is a container. A diagram is not owned by any other element.
        Overrides:
        getOwner in class Element
        Returns:
        the owner of this object, or possibly null, if this element is a diagram.

      • getArrangeData

        public ArrangeData getArrangeData()
        Returns the currently set arrange data for this container. If this returns INHERITED, use #getUsedArrangeData to find the arrange data to be actually used.
        Returns:
        the currently set arrange data for this container

        Sets the style for the container according to which to arrange its elements.
        Parameters:

      • getArrangeStyle

        public ArrangeData.ArrangeStyle getArrangeStyle()
        Gets the style set for this container, including possibly ArrangeData.ArrangeStyle.INHERITED. Use getUsedArrangeStyle() to get the style actually used.
        Returns:
        the style of the container according to which to arrange its elements.

      • getUsedArrangeStyle

        public ArrangeData.ArrangeStyle getUsedArrangeStyle()
        Gets the style of the container according to which its elements will be arranged. The same as getArrangeStyle() unless that is ArrangeData.ArrangeStyle.INHERITED, in which case goes up the element hierarchy until the first element wit ha different style.
        Returns:
        the style of the container according to which to arrange its elements.

      • createBox

        public Box createBox(java.awt.geom.Rectangle2D.Double rectangle,
                     double spacing)
        Creates a new box as a child of this container. The minimum size of the new box is the size of the given rectangle. The whole diagram is reordered afterwards, or at the end of the current transaction.
        Parameters:
        rectangle - the position of the new box
        spacing - the spacing value for the new box
        Returns:
        the new box object.

      • createBox

        public Box createBox(java.awt.geom.Rectangle2D.Double rectangle,
                     ArrangeData.ArrangeStyle arrangeStyle,
                     LayoutConstraints.ConstraintType constraintType,
                     double spacing)
        Creates a new box as a child of this container. The minimum size of the new box is the size of the given rectangle. The whole diagram is reordered afterwards, or at the end of the current transaction.
        Parameters:
        rectangle - the position of the new box
        arrangeStyle - the style according to which to arrange the elements of the new box
        constraintType - the type of the layout constraints for the new box
        spacing - the spacing value for the new box
        Returns:
        the new box object.

      • createBox

        public Box createBox(java.awt.geom.Rectangle2D.Double rectangle,
                     ArrangeData.ArrangeStyle arrangeStyle,
                     LayoutConstraints.ConstraintType constraintType,
                     double spacing,
                     java.lang.Integer row,
                     java.lang.Integer column)
        Creates a new box as a child of this container. The minimum size of the new box is the size of the given rectangle. The whole diagram is reordered afterwards, or at the end of the current transaction.
        Parameters:
        rectangle - the position of the new box
        arrangeStyle - the style according to which to arrange the elements of the new box
        constraintType - the type of the layout constraints for the new box
        spacing - the spacing value for the new box
        row - the row of the new box in this container's grid
        column - the column of the new box in this container's grid
        Returns:
        the new box object.

        public Container createContainer()
        Creates a new container as a child of this container.

                                 LayoutConstraints.ConstraintType constraintType)

        constraintType - the type of the layout constraints for the new container

      • move

        public void move(java.awt.geom.Point2D.Double moveVector,
                 Container newOwner,
                 java.lang.Integer row,
                 java.lang.Integer column)
        Moves the container (its grid and children) by the given vector. The actual size may differ due to children. The new owner of the container will be stretched to accommodate the container children at its desired new position. The whole diagram is reordered afterwards, or at the end of the current transaction.
        Parameters:
        moveVector - the move vector for the container grid and children
        newOwner - the new owner of the container
        row - the row of the container in new owner's grid
        column - the column of the container in new owner's grid

      • move

        public void move(java.awt.geom.Point2D.Double moveVector,
                 Container newOwner)
        Moves the container (its grid and children) by the given vector. The actual size may differ due to children. The new owner of the container will be stretched to accommodate the container children at its desired new position. The whole diagram is reordered afterwards, or at the end of the current transaction.
        Parameters:
        moveVector - the move vector for the container grid and children
        newOwner - the new owner of the container

      • convertToBox

        public Box convertToBox(java.awt.geom.Point2D.Double newCenter,
                        Container newOwner,
                        java.awt.geom.Point2D.Double growPoint)
        Converts this container to a box, keeping all the common properties intact. Places it at the given position, along with its children. The actual size may differ due to children. The new owner of the box will be stretched to accommodate the box at its desired new position. The whole diagram is reordered afterwards, or at the end of the current transaction.
        Parameters:
        newCenter - the new center of the box
        newOwner - the new owner of the box
        growPoint - the exact point at which to insert the box, it will then be grow from that point to its desired position as per Box.resize(java.awt.geom.Rectangle2D.Double)
        Returns:
        the box converted from this container and placed at the given position

      • convertToBox

        public Box convertToBox(java.awt.geom.Point2D.Double newCenter,
                        Container newOwner,
                        java.awt.geom.Point2D.Double growPoint,
                        java.lang.Integer row,
                        java.lang.Integer column)
        Converts this container to a box, keeping all the common properties intact. Places it at the given position, along with its children. The actual size may differ due to children. The new owner of the box will be stretched to accommodate the box at its desired new position. The whole diagram is reordered afterwards, or at the end of the current transaction. If the new owner has grid constraints, puts the new box into the given cell.
        Parameters:
        newCenter - the new center of the box
        newOwner - the new owner of the box
        growPoint - the exact point at which to insert the box, it will then be grow from that point to its desired position as per Box.resize(java.awt.geom.Rectangle2D.Double)
        row - the row of the box in new owner's grid
        column - the column of the box in new owner's grid
        Returns:
        the box converted from this container and placed at the given position

      • convertToContainer

        public Container convertToContainer(java.awt.geom.Point2D.Double moveVector,
                                    Container newOwner)
        Converts this box to a container, keeping all the common properties intact. Moves its grid and children by the given vector. The new owner of the container will be stretched to accommodate the children and grid of the container at its desired new position. The whole diagram is reordered afterwards, or at the end of the current transaction.
        Parameters:
        moveVector - the move vector for the container grid and children
        newOwner - the new owner of the container
        Returns:
        the container converted from this box and placed at the given position

      • convertToContainer

        public Container convertToContainer(java.awt.geom.Point2D.Double moveVector,
                                    Container newOwner,
                                    java.lang.Integer row,
                                    java.lang.Integer column)
        Converts this box to a container, keeping all the common properties intact. Moves its grid and children by the given vector. The new owner of the container will be stretched to accommodate the children and grid of the container at its desired new position. The whole diagram is reordered afterwards, or at the end of the current transaction.
        Parameters:
        moveVector - the move vector for the container grid and children
        newOwner - the new owner of the container
        row - the row of the container in new owner's grid
        column - the column of the container in new owner's grid
        Returns:
        the container converted from this box and placed at the given position

      • findDescendantEnclosingRectangle

        public java.awt.geom.Rectangle2D.Double findDescendantEnclosingRectangle()
        Finds the smallest rectangle containing all of the container's children, including the spacing of the children.
        Overrides:
        findDescendantEnclosingRectangle in class AbstractContainer
        Returns:
        the smallest children enclosing rectangle, or null is the container has no children with dimensions

      • findChildContainerEnclosingRectangle

        public java.awt.geom.Rectangle2D.Double findChildContainerEnclosingRectangle()
        Finds the smallest rectangle containing all of the container's direct descendant child containers, including the spacing of the container bounds.
        Returns:
        the smallest child container enclosing rectangle, or null is the container has no child containers

      • getShape

        public java.awt.geom.Path2D.Double getShape()
        Returns the approximate geometric shape of this container. If container has grid constraints, returns an orthogonal rectangle bounding the grid. Otherwise returns a convex hull enclosing all descendants of the container. If the container is empty, returns null.
        Returns:
        the approximate geometric shape of this container
